body_html:
Very glad that the Windows PR have been accepted into the master branch.

I would like a very detailed tutorial to exist, to assist in getting PyTorch running on Windows.

It would be awesome if I could write it, but I have not yet tried to get it myself, and currently I'm involved in a month-long Hackathon that subtracts me any free time. Also I'm probably not the best one here that can compose such a document.

But I wanted to make a step forward, so I've set up a blank document on Dropbox Paper for open collaboration (anyone can edit) and posting it here so anyone here can try contributing to reach the most straightforward, detailed, step-by-step, you-cannot-fail guide to get PyTorch up and running on a Windows system.

(And maybe in December I will have a good guide to follow for my setup :)

Here's the link:
https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/How-to-have-PyTorch-running-on-Windows-without-making-mess-in-your-current-setup-and-without-hair-falling-step-by-step-you-cannot-fail-tutorial-PIb5ESgeg9bLtIIUxWGkE?_tk=share_copylink

Or the same, shorter: https://rebrand.ly/pytorch-windows-guide

body:
Very glad that the Windows PR have been accepted into the master branch.

I would like a very detailed tutorial to exist, to assist in getting PyTorch running on Windows.

It would be awesome if I could write it, but I have not yet tried to get it myself, and currently I'm involved in a month-long Hackathon that subtracts me any free time. Also I'm probably not the best one here that can compose such a document.

But I wanted to make a step forward, so I've set up a blank document on Dropbox Paper for open collaboration (anyone can edit) and posting it here so anyone here can try contributing to reach the most straightforward, detailed, step-by-step, you-cannot-fail guide to get PyTorch up and running on a Windows system.

(And maybe in December I will have a good guide to follow for my setup :)

Here's the link:
[https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/How-to-have-PyTorch-running-on-Windows-without-making-mess-in-your-current-setup-and-without-hair-falling-step-by-step-you-cannot-fail-tutorial-PIb5ESgeg9bLtIIUxWGkE?_tk=share_copylink](https://paper.dropbox.com/doc/How-to-have-PyTorch-running-on-Windows-without-making-mess-in-your-current-setup-and-without-hair-falling-step-by-step-you-cannot-fail-tutorial-PIb5ESgeg9bLtIIUxWGkE?_tk=share_copylink)

Or the same, shorter: [https://rebrand.ly/pytorch-windows-guide](https://rebrand.ly/pytorch-windows-guide)
